repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
i found a way to redraw with cmd preview is on without flickering. but it needs to be in replace mode to work.
`<left>(character before the cursor)`
overstriking the character before the cursor to position the cursor causing a refresh and not changing the actual text in the command line.

detecting overstrike by changing the command line causes flickering.
i also think adding a way to detect this will allow command line mappings to be more consistent.

comment_regular_data.body: Also, maybe this would be good to PR to Vim first?
maybe, ill make a pr there ig.

How do i fix this?
> FAIL: /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/state.c (File size changed from 9192 to 9193)

rerunning the tests removes 2 failing tests and a new unrelated failing test.
> ~~Error: The action has timed out.~~

~~why?~~

https://github.com/vim/vim/pull/13569

Closing this PR since we'll port the Vim patch (including the tests) when it is merged. Thank you!

title: feat: command-line overstrike detection with mode()/nvim_get_mode()
